metadata.title: CVE-2016-9080 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs were reported in Firefox 50.0.2. Some of these bugsshowed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effortthat some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 50.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9080` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
